introduction.theme: Initial career and financial path choice after graduation.
objectives: Choose between immediate employment or pursuing an MBA.
Understand the short-term and long-term financial implications of the choice.
Establish starting financial position for the game.

decision_point.description: Choose your path after graduation: Enter the workforce immediately or pursue an MBA.

choices.name: Enter Workforce
choices.description: Start earning immediately, gain practical experience.

outcome.narrative: Initial balance +$4,500 (signing bonus). Accumulated wealth after 5 years: $105,000.

choices.name: Pursue MBA
choices.description: Invest in advanced education for potentially higher future earnings.

outcome.narrative: Initial balance -$80,000 (debt). Accumulated wealth after 5 years (2 study, 3 work): $100,000.

level1.theme: Concentration vs. Diversification when investing a $10,000 bonus.
objectives: Understand risk-reward of concentration vs. diversification.

decision_point.description: How to invest a $10,000 performance bonus?

choices.name: Focused Investment (Concentrated Risk)
choices.description: Allocate 80% of bonus to a single promising tech stock (TechNova).

outcome.narrative: High volatility leads to a loss after 12 months. Final balance: $7,200.

choices.name: Varied Portfolio (Diversified Approach)
choices.description: Allocate bonus across TechNova (30%), established tech leaders (30%), and broad market ETFs (40%).

outcome.narrative: Balanced approach yields moderate gains after 12 months. Final balance: $11,500.

choices.name: Expert Consultation (Delegated Diversification)
choices.description: Consult a financial advisor for professional portfolio construction.

outcome.narrative: Professionally managed portfolio provides strong returns after 12 months. Final balance: $12,800.

objectives: Understand mechanics and risks of leverage.

decision_point.description: Choose a strategy for investing $10,000 in a booming cryptocurrency market.

choices.name: All-In Leverage (5x)
choices.description: Maximum leverage on the entire investment.

outcome.narrative: Market correction triggers margin call, resulting in complete loss. Final balance: $0.

choices.name: Diversified Leverage (3x)
choices.description: Moderate leverage spread across multiple cryptocurrencies.

outcome.narrative: Partial liquidations during crash, but modest overall gains. Final balance: $11,000.

choices.name: Conservative Direct Investment (1x)
choices.description: Direct investment without leverage.

outcome.narrative: Experiences significant paper losses during crash but recovers well. Final balance: $11,500.

choices.name: Contrarian Short Position (3x)
choices.description: Leveraged bet against the market momentum.

outcome.narrative: Experiences painful losses initially, then vindication during crash, ending break-even. Final balance: $10,000.

choices.name: Wait and See (Cash)
choices.description: Hold cash and monitor the market.

outcome.narrative: Preserves capital, avoids crash, has opportunity to invest later. Final balance: $10,000.

level3.theme: Reacting to a significant market decline (-22%).

decision_point.description: Your $100,000 portfolio drops to $78,000 (-22%). How do you respond?

choices.name: Panic Sell
choices.description: Sell everything to stop further losses and hold cash.

outcome.narrative: Avoids further immediate loss but misses the recovery over 18 months. Final balance relative to initial $100k: $78,000.

choices.name: Strategic Hold & Buy
choices.description: Hold core positions and buy quality assets at discounts.

outcome.narrative: Experiences further temporary losses but recovers strongly over 18 months. Final balance relative to initial $100k: $89,700.

choices.name: Diversified Rebalancing
choices.description: Reduce highest risk exposures, maintain market participation.

outcome.narrative: Reduces volatility and partially participates in recovery over 18 months. Final balance relative to initial $100k: $85,800.

level4.theme: Resisting hype and FOMO during a popular IPO.

decision_point.description: Decide on an investment strategy for the hyped 'QuickBite' IPO (priced at $45).

choices.name: Margin Play (High Risk/Reward)
choices.description: Invest heavily using margin at the open to capture momentum.

outcome.narrative: Outcome highly dependent on timing. Stock opens +50%, closes day 1 +40%, drops sharply (-35%) after first earnings report (final price $37.70, -16.2% from IPO price).

choices.name: Wait and See (Cautious)
choices.description: Skip initial trading, wait for post-IPO data and potentially lower entry points.

outcome.narrative: Avoids initial volatility and post-earnings drop. Preserves capital, opportunity to buy later at $37.70.

choices.name: Dollar-Cost Averaging (Balanced)
choices.description: Build position gradually over time (IPO day, post-earnings, etc.).

outcome.narrative: Averages cost basis, likely resulting in a loss after earnings, but less severe than buying all at peak. Specific % change depends on entry points.

level5.theme: Navigating social pressure and potential bubbles in a hot real estate market.

decision_point.description: Choose whether to buy property in a rapidly appreciating neighborhood or continue renting.

choices.name: Luxury Stretch Purchase
choices.description: Buy an expensive property requiring 40% of income for payments.

outcome.narrative: After market shifts (rates rise), home equity drops (-5%), financial stress becomes high.

choices.name: Balanced Purchase
choices.description: Buy a modest property requiring 25% of income for payments.

outcome.narrative: After market shifts, home equity drops slightly (-2%), financial stress remains low due to buffer.

choices.name: Continue Renting
choices.description: Maintain flexibility and invest potential down payment elsewhere.

outcome.narrative: Avoids housing correction, maintains maximum flexibility and low financial stress. Opportunity to buy later.

level6.theme: Dealing with emotional attachment to inherited investments (Endowment Effect).

decision_point.description: Decide what to do with inherited shares of 'MidCentury Manufacturing', a company important to your family but now underperforming.

choices.name: Keep All Shares
choices.description: Hold onto the entire inherited stock position due to emotional attachment.

outcome.narrative: Stock continues to decline over 5 years, significantly dragging down overall portfolio performance. Value of these shares drops 35%.

choices.name: Partial Transition
choices.description: Keep a small symbolic portion (10%), reinvest the rest (90%), and find other ways to honor legacy.

outcome.narrative: Balanced outcome over 5 years. The 10% retained portion declines (-35%), but the reinvested 90% achieves market growth, leading to modest overall growth for the inherited value. Honors legacy and financial responsibility.

choices.name: Complete Reallocation
choices.description: Sell all inherited shares and reinvest strategically in line with current financial goals.

outcome.narrative: New investments significantly outperform the legacy stock over 5 years (e.g., +50% vs -35%, an 85% outperformance). Maximizes financial outcome but requires managing emotional/family aspects.

level7.theme: Integrating multiple biases into holistic financial planning at mid-life (age 40).
objectives: Balance present desires vs. long-term security.

decision_point.description: Choose a comprehensive financial planning approach for the next 20 years, starting with a net worth of $425,000.

choices.name: Status Quo Bias Path
choices.description: Make minimal changes to current investment, protection, and tax strategies.

outcome.narrative: Modest progress over 20 years, significant vulnerabilities remain. Projected Net Worth at Age 60: $1.4M.

choices.name: Optimization Path
choices.description: Implement strategic rebalancing, phased protection planning, and advanced tax optimization.

outcome.narrative: Enhanced security and strong growth over 20 years with moderate lifestyle adaptation. Projected Net Worth at Age 60: $2.6M.

choices.name: Transformation Path
choices.description: Undertake significant financial restructuring, aggressive corrections, and maximum protection/wealth strategies.

outcome.narrative: Maximizes long-term results over 20 years but requires significant short-term adjustments. Projected Net Worth at Age 60: $3.2M.

level8.theme: Navigating social dynamics and group influence in investment decisions (Investment Club).

decision_point.description: Choose how to engage and make decisions within an investment club over a 6-month period.

choices.name: Independent Thinker Path
choices.description: Rely on independent research and maintain conviction despite group pressure.

outcome.narrative: Achieves above-average returns but may become socially isolated. Example decision: Contrarian value stock (Month 2) appreciates 30% if chosen.

choices.name: Social Navigator Path
choices.description: Prioritize building relationships and aligning with group consensus.

outcome.narrative: Well-liked and central to group, achieves average returns aligned with consensus.

choices.name: Selective Engagement Path
choices.description: Balance independent analysis with group interaction, verifying key claims.

outcome.narrative: Respected for thoughtful contributions, achieves balanced returns.
